Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Personal possessions; money; clothing; storage space
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4125
Section (1) A licensee shall have a written policy that designates all of the
Description following:
1

(c) The method for ensuring that each resident has sufficient
clean, properly fitting, seasonal clothing.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Six days ago, youth ripped his facility issued shoes during
basketball and has not been issued new ones since then. Youth
went to ER only wearing socks.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on August
14, 2024. Youth A presented at the interview with new flipflops on
his feet, he stated he was given them at lunchtime. Youth A said
he was given shoes and flipflops when he was placed at Clarence
Fischer Center. Youth A said staff took his shoes away from him
after he attempted to hang himself in the bathroom. Youth A said
staff told him he was unable to have them due to the shoelaces.
Youth A said he had to wear his flipflops since that time and they
broke while he was playing basketball. Youth A said he went over
a week without any shoes or flipflops. Youth A said Youth B
allowed him to borrow his shoes and flipflops a “few times”. Youth
A said he then attempted to runaway last night with Youth B’s
shoes and those were then taken as well. Youth A said he got bit
by a snake and had to go the urgent care for an exam and did not
have shoes. Youth A said he asked staff for shoes, unable to
remember which staff, and was not given any so went to urgent
care in socks. Youth A said he has requested new shoes or
flipflops from “all staff” for about “a week” and was finally given
flipflops today.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on August
14, 2024. Youth B said all youth are given one pair of tennis shoes
and one pair of flipflops at intake. Youth B said Youth A was given
shoes and flipflops however staff took his shoes due to him
attempting to runaway. Youth B said Youth A did not have shoes
and had to play basketball in his flipflops and they broke. Youth B
said he then allowed Youth A to borrow his flipflops and shoes due
to not having any. Youth B said Youth A then tried to run again and
staff took Youth B’s shoes. Youth B said Youth A has not gone
without either shoes or flipflops because he shared his with Youth
A. Youth B said he did not see what Youth A was wearing on his
feet when he left or returned from the urgent care on Friday.
Supervisor Z was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
August 14, 2024. Supervisor Z said he recently transferred from
Vassar House to Clarence Fischer Center. Supervisor Z said the
youth are all provided a pair of shoes and flipflops at intake.
2

Supervisor Z said he is not aware of Youth A going without shoes
or needing new shoes or flipflops. Supervisor Z said since he has
been working at Clarence Fisher Center Youth A has had shoes or
flipflops.
Supervisor Y was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
August 14, 2024. Supervisor Y said she had no knowledge of
Youth A being brought to the hospital without shoes or flipflops.
Supervisor Y said she has replaced Youth A’s flipflops about four
different times. Supervisor Y said there is no current process in
place that documents when a youth is given new items.
Supervisor Y said youth’s shoes are removed if they are a flight
risk or have suicidal issues however, they should always have
their flipflops.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on August
14, 2024. Staff 1 said when a youth arrives at the facility all their
personal items are inventoried and go into storage. Staff 1 said all
youth are provided one pair of tennis shoes and one pair of
flipflops. Staff 1 said on Friday he took Youth A to the hospital, and
he did not have shoes or flipflops and was wearing socks. Staff 1
said Youth A did not have shoes or flipflops due to suicidal issues
stating the shoes have shoelaces that could be used, and the
youth have been eating the rubber pieces from their flipflops. Staff
1 said Youth A was “having issues all day” and it was in the
evening when he had to be brought to the hospital due to a snake
bite. Staff 1 said he does not know where Youth A’s shoes were
being kept. Staff 1 said only Supervisor Y has a key to the
inventory room to get new shoes or flipflops for youth and she was
not working Friday evening. Staff 1 said he was aware Youth A
was in socks and did not do anything to provide Youth A shoes
when they went to the hospital.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on August 20, 2024.
Staff 2 said all youth are provided one pair of shoes and one pair
of flipflops at intake. Staff 2 said Youth A had his shoes taken
because he would “run off constantly”. Staff 2 said Youth A has
flipflops however another youth ripped them in half and he was
unsure of the date that occurred. Staff 2 said Youth A was without
shoes and flipflops for a “few days”. Staff 2 said Supervisor Y is
the only person with a key to the inventory closet, so he was not
able to get Youth A any new shoes of flipflops. Staff 2 said he does
not know where staff put Youth A’s shoes when they took them for
his runaway behavior. Staff 2 said he was aware that Youth A went
to the hospital in socks on August 9, 2024. Staff 2 said youth will
have their shoes taken if they are a runaway risk or a suicide risk.
3

Staff 2 said staff do not take youth’s flipflops for runaway behavior
or suicidal issues.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s clothing inventory dated July 8, 2024, was
reviewed. The inventory documented Youth A was provided
one pair of shoes at intake.
• Medical Documentation for Youth A dated August 9, 2024.
There was no information about whether or not he was
wearing footwear in the report.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per interviews with
Staff 1, Staff 2 and Youth A, it is determined Youth A was without
any footwear for an undetermined amount of time and was
brought to the hospital in socks.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
